sentences: Kuhu minek? Tädi poole, arsti juurde, järvele, jalutama, eksamile minek.
Rongi, bussi minekuni on veel aega.
Isa oli enne minekut mitu kuud voodihaige.
context: The Estonian word 'minek' has multiple meanings depending on context. It can refer to the act of going or moving (departure, journey), leaving a place (leaving, departure), death (demise), transition into another state or condition, demand/popularity (demand, marketability), or progress/advancement (progress, success). The word appears in various compound forms indicating direction or purpose like 'koju minek' (going home) or 'sõtta minek' (going to war).
